alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 17 at 2:56PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 256 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Of Brownsville, Southmost, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville, Rivera High School, El Jardin Elementary School, Gonzalez Elementary School, Perkins Middle School, Brownsville South Padre Island International Airport, North Brownsville Little League, Gallegos Elementary School, Brownsville Fire Department Station Six, Hanna High School, Vela Middle School, Brownsville Event Center, Northside Transfer Station, B I S D Administration Building, Faulk Middle School and Brownsville Golf Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
